div1.p: Hench thanks Truby for making corrections in his letter to Ramos.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, March 13, 1941
div1.opener:
March 13, 1941
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
I am sending you by separate post a copy of the 1902 and 1907
maps of Camp Columbia, with a key to the numbers of the 1907 map. I
shall keep after Mr. Freer to see if they can find the key to the 1902
map. I enclose a carbon copy of a letter to Colonel Willis, and I agree
with you that it will be an excellent thing if they do remount the
model with the buildings properly spaced, and rephotograph it for us.
As I have bothered him so much, I am wondering if he is not approaching
the limit of his patience with me. I really think that he would accept
your suggestions at the moment much better than mine.

I think you saw the second photographs that General Brooke
sent me. Although they were set up wrong, the buildings in these photo-
graphs showed up much better than in the last ones sent to me by Colonel
Willis. General Brooke had the photographer take the photographs higher
in the air and it showed them much better.

Thank you very kindly for correcting your letter to Dr. Ramos.
I am asking our photographic department to send you three copies of the
enlarged photographic portion of the 1902 map. I am very glad to have
you keep the photographs that you were interested in.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
